lines.text: Mr. Rixley?
That's right.
My name is Frank James. I came here to turn myself in. Here's my gun. I want something in return. I want to be able to bury my brother.
Suppose I don't agree to your terms?
Then I'll kill you.
[Now points his gun at Mr. Rixley, cocks hammer back]
When this is all over, I'm goin' to write a book; make myself more famous than I already am.
I trust you'll give me a copy.
Nope. You gotta pay, Frank; you gotta pay.
[Jesse is meeting with the Ford Brothers]
It ain't straight.
What?
That sampler; it ain't straight
[turns his back on the Fords]

[pulls his gun]
I shot Jesse James.
[shoots Jesse in the back]
Coleman Younger! Seems like you folks are havin' a real nice party in there.
I expect so, with free food and drink and all.
How come I wasn't invited?
'Cause you're a whore, Belle.
I might be; but at least I ain't a cheap one.
The funeral will be in Chicago and the Governor will be there.
Well, I'm sure it will cheer their souls just to hear you say that.
[Cole Younger and Sam Starr are about to fight over Belle]
What does the winner get?
Nothin' both of you ain't already had.
Don't hardly seem worth it.
It ain't. You're both crazy, but you do keep me amused. I am having a *real* good time.
[Rixley is trying to get Ed Miller to inform on the James/Younger gang]

Let me tell you one damn thing. I turn 'em in and I'm gonna get killed by one of their relatives sure as hell. Now I got six months to go here for bustin' up a place drunk, so I'll just take my chances, all right? Besides, Jesse just might change his mind, and he pays better wages than you do, Pinkerton Man.
Mrs. James, we are going to search your house. I don't suppose it would do any good to ask nicely?
It won't do you any good to ask at all.
You know, those men of yours are going to wind up dead or they're going to wind up worse.

[during a train robbery]
Who the hell do you think you are, Jesse James?
Hell, no! I'm Bob Younger. Jesse James rides with the Youngers. Now, stop the damn train!

[before the Northfield Raid]
Maybe we need to send a couple of people down there and look things over before we just ride in there.
Clell's already scouted it out. What's wrong with you, Jim? Talkin' soft is something I'd expect from Cole or Frank.
I gave up tryin' to talk sense to you a long time ago, Jesse.
You still chargin' $15?

[laughing]
I sure am.

[shaking his head]
Lot of money.
Well, at the rate you're losin' you won't have to worry about it. Course you could always hold up another bank; scare some more innocent people half to death.

[regarding the Northfield Raid]
That's kinda off our range, ain't it, Jesse? There's still a lot of banks and cathouses in Missouri we ain't done.

[Jesse has decided to leave the Youngers for the posse to find]
I like it better this way, Jesse; I get to see you run.

[gazing at Wilhelmina across a crowded dance floor]
I got a question for you.
Fire away, Frank. Fire away and fall back.
You ever been in love?
Oh God, yes. It was terrible. An affliction. Really miserable. Nothing but trouble. Drove me crazy.
That bad? Really?
Yes. She was wonderful.
I want your sons, Mrs. Samuel.
What do you want them for?
For robbing banks, ma'am.
Jim Younger, there are some things that a gentleman does not ask a lady!
Beth, when you're old enough to call yourself a lady, I'll keep that in mind.
[on Jesse's relationship with Zee Mimms]
The next thing you know, he'll ask her to marry him and settle down.
The first part, anyway.
First getting shot, then getting married - bad habits.
What do you and your brothers think about a life sentence? I mean, you're lucky they don't allow hanging in this state. Come on, Cole, tell me what you think about this?
Ah, hell. We played a rough game... and we lost.

[Cole Younger and Sam Starr are about to fight over Belle]
Well... I'm glad I caught you in a good mood.
